intro: Ardisia meiantha, commonly known as the small-flowered ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruits are bright red berries that mature in the fall, attracting various bird species. Ardisia meiantha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
